DOC.brief_summary: The purpose of this study is to evaluate whether treated with hydroxychloroquine could improve therapeutic effect for patients with high-risk coronary artery disease.
DOC.brief_title: Efficacy Study of Hydroxychloroquine to Treat High-risk Coronary Artery Disease.
DOC.detailed_description: This double blind, placebo, randomized controlled cross-over trial is going to assess if hydroxychloroquine could improve the high sensitivity C-reaction protein, blood lipid, blood glucose and blood pressure, also whether hydroxychloroquine could affect the secretion of inflammatory cytokines and the M1/M2 phenotype polarization of macrophages in patients with high-risk coronary artery disease.
DOC.criteria: Patients have the symptom of angina and STT change, as well as one coronary artery stenosis≥50% at least confirmed by coronary angiography or CT angiography at the age of 1875 years old. High sensitivity Creactive protein >3mg/L, GRACE risk score≥90 . On guidelinebased secondary prevention of coronary heart disease medications≥3 months. No use of steroids, antibiotics, immunosuppressors a week before treatment. Retinal disease. Chronic hepatopathy. Renal dysfunction (creatinine>175mmol/L). Moderately severe anemia, thrombocytopenia and leukocytopenia. Other contraindications for hydroxychloroquine. Active hemorrhage. Cancer or life expectancy< a year. New York Heart Association (NYHA) functional class≥class III, Percutaneous Coronary Intervention or Coronary Artery Bypass Grafting in plan. Pregnancy and lactation.
